title: Silly symphonies. Limited gold edition
abstract: Birds in spring (dir. Dave Hand, 1933, 7 min.)--The China shop (dir. Wilfred Jackson, 1934, 8 min.)--The Flying mouse (dir. Dave Hand, 1934, 10 min.)--The Cookie carnival (dir. Ben Sharpsteen, 1935, 8 min.)--Woodland cafe (dir. Wilfred Jackson, 1937, 8 min.)--Moth and the flame (dir. Bert Gillett, 1938, 8 min.)--Farmyard symphony (dir. Jack Cutting, 1938, 8 min.)
description: Silly Symphonies is a delightful presentation of seven animations from the Disney studios which are not focused on a main character or a plot but rather bring to life inanimate objects, cakes and plates as well as insects and animals. These more experimental animations allowed the animators freedom and expression developing new ideas and animation techniques. These innovative animations are exciting and a joy to watch.
